Header: SERRIC Holds Special Ceremony on Children’s Day
Content: ‘Senehasa’ Education Resource Research & Information Centre (SERRIC), managed by the Army Seva Vanitha Unit at the Army Headquarters marked the World Children’s Day at the Sri Lanka Foundation Institute (SLFI) on Tuesday (1). Mrs Sujeewa Nelson, President, Army Seva Vanitha Unit (ASVU) as the Chief Guest participated in the ceremony where the children had the opportunity of presenting their aesthetic skills before the attendees in the ceremony. SERRIC takes care of children of tri-service families with special needs by holding training sessions and day care programmes with the support of experts. Towards the end of the day’s project, Mrs Sujeewa Nelson meeting each and every child gave each of them a gift parcel on account of the World Children’s Day. The day’s Chief Guest on arrival at the venue was welcomed by a few children offering bouquets of flowers. Lighting of the traditional oil lamp set the stage ready for the day’s proceedings. Commandant, SERRIC, ASVU senior members and several invitees attended the event.
